explanation: The report is not correct. MISRA Rule 2.2 targets executed operations whose removal would not affect program behaviour (i.e. true “dead” operations). The mhd_assert macro in this project is an annotation/diagnostic macro that is defined to ((void)0). When expanded it produces a no‑op expression-statement used as a placeholder for disabled diagnostics. Such an expansion does not correspond to an executed operation with side-effects and is the conventional idiom for an empty assertion macro. Moreover, the statement is an annotation that may be enabled in other build/configuration variants of the same project (i.e. it is a conditional diagnostic that can become effective), so it is not semantically “dead” across the project as a whole. For these reasons the particular assert line does not constitute a MISRA 2.2 violation in the supplied project context. If a static analysis tool flags these, the appropriate remediation is to configure the tool to ignore intentionally empty diagnostic/assert macros or to provide a project-wide exemption, not to treat the assert usages as dead code requiring removal.
